ack.p: We thank S. Grosshuesch and K. Dutta for analytical support, J. Halbur and L. Strzok for help with sample preparation, A. Breckenridge for help with paleomagnetic interpretation, J. Li for insights in modelling diagenesis, and the crew of the R/V Blue Heron and Lake Guardian for their expertise during core collection. Additional thanks go to Sue Beske-Diehl and Julie Bowles for paleomagnetic analysis, as well as Paul Wilkonson, Robert Flett and Dan Engstrom for 210Pb analysis. The National Lacustrine Core Facility (LacCore) provided accommodation for core splitting, initial core description and sampling. This work is the result of research sponsored by the Minnesota Sea Grant College Program, supported by the NOAA National Sea Grant office, United States Department of Commerce, under grant No. NA07OAR4170009 to R.E.H., T.C.J. and J.P.W. The U.S. Government is authorized to reproduce and distribute reprints for government purposes, not withstanding any copyright notation that may appear hereon. This paper is journal reprint No. JR639 of the Minnesota Sea Grant College Program. Additional support for this research was provided by the National Science Foundation (NSF), grant No. OCE 0961720 to S.K., R.E.H. and J.P.W., and U.S. Environmental Protection Agency Cooperative Agreement GL-00E00790-2 to E.D.R. This document has not been subjected to the Agency's required peer and policy review and therefore does not necessarily reflect the view of the Agency, and no official endorsement should be inferred.
